intro: Cyathula braunii, commonly known as the Brazilian spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with simple, alternate leaves that are often lance-shaped. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures typical of the genus. Cyathula braunii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
